byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and ALAN COWELL

abstract: British lawmakers Malcolm Rifkind and Jack Straw face investigations after media sting conducted by Channel 4 and The Daily Telegraph caught them offering influence in exchange for money.
lead_paragraph: Both Malcolm Rifkind, a member of the governing Conservative Party, and Jack Straw, of the opposition Labour Party, acknowledged meeting with an undercover journalist who claimed to represent a company and offered to pay them to use their influence.

headline.main: Two Former Cabinet Ministers in Britain Deny Wrongdoing After Graft Allegations
headline.print_headline: Two Former Cabinet Ministers in Britain Deny Wrongdoing After Graft Allegations

snippet: Both Malcolm Rifkind, a member of the governing Conservative Party, and Jack Straw, of the opposition Labour Party, acknowledged meeting with an undercover journalist who claimed to represent a company and offered to pay them to use their influence.
